articles.title: Citing ‘hate’ and child exploitation, AG Campbell logs off X
articles.description:
Attorney General Andrea Campbell described X, formerly known as Twitter, as a platform with "no accountability and no guardrails."

The post Citing ‘hate’ and child exploitation, AG Campbell logs off X appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: AG Andrea Campbell quits X, citing concerns over hate and child exploitation.
Campbell criticized X for lacking accountability and safety measures for users.
Boston residents may face increased risks online without proper platform regulations.

articles.title: Pregnant woman hospitalized after ICE detention in Burlington
articles.description:
"Their goal is really just to detain as many people as possible wherever they find them," the woman's lawyer said.

The post Pregnant woman hospitalized after ICE detention in Burlington appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Pregnant woman hospitalized after being detained by ICE in Burlington.
Lawyer claims ICE aims to detain as many individuals as possible.
Incident raises concerns about treatment of detainees in Massachusetts.

articles.title: Amtrak service between Boston and New York suspended due to nor’easter
articles.description:
Service will remain suspended until at least 4 p.m., according to officials.

The post Amtrak service between Boston and New York suspended due to nor’easter appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Amtrak service between Boston and New York is suspended due to a nor’easter.
Service suspension will last until at least 4 p.m. today, February 23.
Boston residents relying on this route face travel disruptions and delays.

articles.title: Lindsey Vonn says surgery saved her from having her left leg amputated following Olympic crash
articles.description:
The 41-year-old Vonn said the trauma from the crash led to compartment syndrome in the leg.

The post Lindsey Vonn says surgery saved her from having her left leg amputated following Olympic crash appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lindsey Vonn underwent surgery to prevent leg amputation after a serious Olympic crash.
The 41-year-old athlete experienced compartment syndrome in her left leg due to trauma.
Vonn's recovery highlights the importance of advanced medical care for local athletes.

articles.title: ‘He said that?’: Joe Mazzulla’s reaction to Pat Riley’s Boston trash talk
articles.description:
"That’s fun. That’s awesome. Damn.”

The post ‘He said that?’: Joe Mazzulla’s reaction to Pat Riley’s Boston trash talk appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Joe Mazzulla reacted positively to Pat Riley's recent comments about the Celtics.
Riley's trash talk adds fuel to the Celtics-Heat rivalry ahead of their next matchup.
Boston fans can expect heightened excitement and intensity during upcoming games.

articles.title: Town-by-town snow totals: Here’s what’s fallen so far in Mass.
articles.description:
Some areas were already approaching 20 inches by Monday morning.

The post Town-by-town snow totals: Here’s what’s fallen so far in Mass. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts towns report snow totals nearing 20 inches as of Monday morning.
Boston residents experienced significant snowfall, impacting travel and daily activities.
Local authorities are preparing for potential disruptions due to ongoing winter weather.

articles.title: Here’s a broader look at how the storm is impacting the East Coast
articles.description:
Blizzard warnings stretched from Maryland to Maine.

The post Here’s a broader look at how the storm is impacting the East Coast appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Blizzard warnings issued for Boston as storm affects East Coast.
Storm expected to bring up to 12 inches of snow by February 24.
Public transportation may face delays and disruptions due to severe weather.
